channel.title: Rounding in a console [VB]
channel.description:
[code] Module Module1
Sub Main() Console.WriteLine("What do you want to round to. Decimal Places or significant figures?") Console.WriteLine("1 for DP 2 for SF") Dim opt As Integer = Console.ReadLine() Console.WriteLine() If opt = 1 Then Console.WriteLine("enter your number:") Dim number As Double = Console.ReadLine() number.ToString() Console.WriteLine("how many decimal places do you want to round to?") Dim places As Integer = Console.ReadLine() Console.WriteLine() Console.WriteLine("{0:n" & places & "}", number)
ElseIf opt = 2 Then Console.WriteLine("enter your number:") Dim number As Integer = Console.ReadLine() number.ToString() Console.WriteLine("how many significant figures do you want to round to?") Dim places As Integer = Console.ReadLine() Console.WriteLine() Console.WriteLine("{" & places & ":0}", number) ElseIf opt <> 1 Or 2 Then Console.WriteLine("Incorrect choice. Choose either 1 or 2") End If Console.ReadLine()
End Sub
End Module[/code]
The significant figure i had no clue how to do but the decimal seems to be working perfectly. Any help with the SF?

item.title: Rounding in a console [VB]
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

Lin:

Visual Basic is the worst programming language I’ve ever used. It improved when there was VB .NET, but even still it’s a terrible language and anything you can do using it you can do in C# better. You’re more flexible and not only that, but you’re not typing full words when you can type a single character. End Sub? That’s just awful.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

[quote=“NieX, post:5, topic:522755”]why recommend that? I don’t understand half of this community… What’s the reason for me going from VB to c# or are you just copying the guy above me that doesn’t like vb? Why not c++? it’s more object orientated than sharp :s If you’re going to change someones opinion on something you’re going to need a valid reason. If there’s a genuine problem with VB which makes c# better then i’ll change, gladly… But people just posting comments like “use c#” or whatever It just leaves me confused.[/quote]Visual Basic is the worst programming language I’ve ever used. It improved when there was VB .NET, but even still it’s a terrible language and anything you can do using it you can do in C# better. You’re more flexible and not only that, but you’re not typing full words when you can type a single character. End Sub? That’s just awful.

item.title: Rounding in a console [VB]
item.dc:creator: @NieX NieX
item.description:
@NieX wrote:

[code]
Module Module1

Sub Main()
    Console.WriteLine("What do you want to round to. Decimal Places or significant figures?")
    Console.WriteLine("1 for DP      2 for SF")
    Dim opt As Integer = Console.ReadLine()
    Console.WriteLine()
    If opt = 1 Then
        Console.WriteLine("enter your number:")
        Dim number As Double = Console.ReadLine()
        number.ToString()
        Console.WriteLine("how many decimal places do you want to round to?")
        Dim places As Integer = Console.ReadLine()
        Console.WriteLine()
        Console.WriteLine("{0:n" & places & "}", number)

    ElseIf opt = 2 Then
        Console.WriteLine("enter your number:")
        Dim number As Integer = Console.ReadLine()
        number.ToString()
        Console.WriteLine("how many significant figures do you want to round to?")
        Dim places As Integer = Console.ReadLine()
        Console.WriteLine()
        Console.WriteLine("{" & places & ":0}", number)
    ElseIf opt <> 1 Or 2 Then
        Console.WriteLine("Incorrect choice. Choose either 1 or 2")
    End If
    Console.ReadLine()

End Sub

End Module[/code]

The significant figure i had no clue how to do but the decimal seems to be working perfectly. Any help with the SF?

Read full topic
